text: <@U03B14DUZSA> Thanks for the link. I wasn't able to figure out whether they we're able read Smalltalk code in the sense that the visuals were persisted/encoded as traditional Smalltalk files that you could continue working on with a text editor. One of the key things we're doing with ODC is to keep the original source language, e.g. TypeScript, intact by natively reading and writing to it so that devs can collaborate on the files without friction or loss of detail.

elements.text: Thanks for the link. I wasn't able to figure out whether they we're able read Smalltalk code in the sense that the visuals were persisted/encoded as traditional Smalltalk files that you could continue working on with a text editor. One of the key things we're doing with ODC is to keep the original source language, e.g. TypeScript, intact by natively reading and writing to it so that devs can collaborate on the files without friction or loss of detail.
